aa

Class Input

  • java.lang.Object
    • aa.Input

  • public class Input
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to represent all of the data in the input. Saves the elements, relations and facts in the input, as well as the search parameters. Includes methods for an input parser.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Input

        public Input()
        Default constructor

      • Input

        public Input(int v,
     int s,
     int c,
     int t,
     java.util.ArrayList<Relation> r,
     java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> e,
     java.lang.String f)
        Full constructor
        Parameters:
        v - the limit on the number of variables to use in generated formulas
        s - the limit on the number of operators to use in generated formulas
        c - "chunksize", the number of premises to use in each proof
        t - timeout limit, the amount of time to wait for a result from Prover9 or Mace4
        r - an ArrayList of the Relations in the input
        e - an ArrayList of the elements in the input
        f - the name of the input file

        get the input elements
        Returns:
        a String ArrayList of domain elements

        Get the name of the input file
        Returns:
        the name of the input file

      • generateOutputName

        public java.lang.String generateOutputName()
        Generate a distinct output filename for each input filename. This avoid overwrites of unrelated output files. For an input file named "myfile.txt", returns the name "output(myfile).txt"
        Returns:
        a String name for the output file

      • varLimit

        public int varLimit()
        Get the variable limit for the search space
        Returns:
        the variable limit

      • sizeLimit

        public int sizeLimit()
        Get the size (number of operators) limit for the search space
        Returns:
        the size limit

      • timeout

        public int timeout()
        Get the Prover9/Mace4 timeout in seconds, the amount of time to wait for a result before giving up.
        Returns:
        timeout limit in seconds

      • useChunking

        public boolean useChunking()
        Get whether this input uses partial search by only checking smaller "chunks" of premises for each prover call
        Returns:
        true if chunking used

      • setUseChunking

        public void setUseChunking(boolean b)
        Set whether this input should use partial search by only checking smaller "chunks" of premises for each prover call.
        Parameters:
        b - set true to use chunking

      • chunkSize

        public int chunkSize()
        Get the number of premises printed for each Prover9/Mace4 call.
        Returns:
        the number of premises printed

      • setChunkSize

        public void setChunkSize(int c)
        Set the number of premises to print for each Prover9/Mace4 call. Default is to print all premises each time, which is slower.

      • parse

        public static Input parse(java.io.File file)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Parser for the input file
        Parameters:
        file - a Java File object for the input file
        Returns:
        a new Input object capturing all the data in the input file
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
